user_device_rel: 1 person to n devices; n people to m devices
unsolved: Mapping user-defined gesture to application commands
use_cases_desc:
*Situational impairments*: Users remap commands due to temporal constraints (e.g., access to a laptop during a presentation is restricted because of configuration of the environement)

*Optimizing input*: Remap functions to improve, e.g. interaction accuracy, speed, ...

*Allowing multi-user input*: Expand same interactions to multiple devices, for example, to allow multiple users to advance slides (e.g., keyboard and touch device simultaneously)

*Distribute complex UI on multiple devices*: outsourcing of UI elements onto other devices
evaluation: Evaluation of time to create user-defined mappings; Evaluation of accuracy detecting gestures and command mappings
contribution_desc: A general cross-device input framework that allows users to remap functions of an (unodified) application to user-defined gestures. User for example can remap the commands to navigate through a slide deck (i.e. arrow left/right key) to a swipe gesture (i.e. left/right swipe) executed on a touch device.
device_models: MacBook Pro running Chrome and the Chrome extension; Samsung Galaxy S6 Phone
